subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Right to Be Forgotten: Can You Erase Your Past?
description: Learn The Right to Be Forgotten: Can You Erase Your Past? in one minute.

hook.text: A Spanish man asked Google to remove a 16-year-old newspaper link about his debts. He won â€” and changed internet law.

buildup.text: In 2014, the EU Court ruled that individuals can request search engines remove links to outdated personal information.

discovery.text: Google received over 1.3 million removal requests in the first 5 years. They approved about 47% of them.

twist.text: The right clashes with press freedom and historical record. Where does privacy end and censorship begin?

climax.text: The right to be forgotten acknowledges that your worst Google result shouldn't define you forever.

punchline.text: You can ask the internet to forget you. Sometimes it agrees.

quiz.question: What does the 'right to be forgotten' allow individuals to do?
options: Request search engines remove links to outdated personal information
Sue anyone who mentions them online
